reviewText:
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
Overview:Fowl Space is one of the most mixed up and weirdest games I‚Äôve ever played. The devs of the game haven‚Äôt made the point of this game clear enough, rounding up many negative reviews from the users who may not understand or appreciate the hidden humour within.

The theme of Fowl Space is peculiar, though it feel somewhat original and refreshing. A light background which contrasts with the dark foreground, is different and not common within the world of gaming. The story has you controlling a Rooster, a milk-gun wielding, coffee drinking, Rooster. The story is hard to follow which loses many players, sending them into a negative-review rage.

The gameplay has you mainly fighting little to large Vikings. It has some Platformer potential, proving somewhat fun for short bursts of play. A problem users had were it felt like you were walking on ice. The game is supposedly set out of space, where the gravity isn‚Äôt as apparent.

Another enjoyable feature, which I personally enjoyed, was the ability to collect hats and masks throughout the story. The ability to collect a power-up which grants you three killer whales, knocking all enemies and killing them.

One of the interesting aspects of Fowl Space is it is full of sexual innuendos and a parody of popular culture, turning it into an interesting parody. Though the game is very simplistic, not having much going for it. Long play becomes very repetitive, and players who do not understand the referencing going on, find it utter rubbish.

‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
Positives:‚òÜUnique.
‚òÜInteresting artstyle.
‚òÜFull of sexual innuendos.

Negatives:‚òÜStory hard to follow.
‚òÜVery simplistic.

‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
Summary:Overall, the game was enjoyable, simplistic and in my opinion, the negative reviews were unneeded. The whole point of the game is the bad puns, the horrible memes. If they took a bit more time to informatively conduct a proper review, the site states a ‚Äúcrazy experience you will never forget‚Ä¶ to say the least‚Äù. This game was meant to be ‚Äúbad‚Äù in a way. The game is simplistic, and I‚Äôm not saying it was wonderfully addicting, though every game needs a chance.

‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïêFind this review helpful? Join Immortis Gaming for more reviews, cheap game deals, bundles and giveaways!

reviewText: Fowl Space is full of sexual innuendos and parodies. It is this comedy that makes Fowl Space an enjoyable game. However if you drop the jokes you're left with a very short and simplistic platform game. If you're not amused by the idea of a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• shooting a dubious white substance in the face of a viking, you better leave Fowl Space alone.

reviewText:
I bought this game while it was in a sale. Not sure why... but I think the Steam Gods like to tempt me into buying things because, well, you know, it's cheap. It's actually pretty odd as games go. You're a space chicken trying to do something or other, who drinks coffee, combats space Vikings and collects hats.

Don't make the mistake of taking this game seriously. It's a parody of popular culture. With meme, film, music and game references this game is a nod to internet culture. The game did cause me one or two internal laughs. The whole point is to feel 'in on the joke' as it were.

Although I don't think it's fitting of its' ¬£3.99 price tag. The controls de-sync sometimes, the game is nonsense to those who don't know what it‚Äôs referencing and it's rather unpolished. Controller support, better controls and support of different resolutions would add to the over-all quality of the game.

I did, however, enjoy the game despites its' flaws. There is some minor re-playability if you want to collect all of the hats and do all of the challenges.

4/10. Amusing but flawed. If you like internet culture, and fancy a giggle, pick it up in a sale. Don‚Äôt expect serious, or well-polished, game play. Enjoyable none the less.

reviewText:
It can't seem to find its own style, it tries too hard to be Castle Crashers, while trying to look like Limbo. Trying to be hilarious by being whacky solely for the sake of being whacky, it just doesn't have any flair.
Jokes that an unwell 3 year old could write between brain operations with all the charm of a half eaten burrito hanging shamefully out out of the bin from the night before.

The controls are sloppy, nauseating and plain awkward. You know you're doing something wrong when every level feels like the ICE LEVEL! Slip slide and clunk your way across the same looking backdrops with a slightly different colour hew each time.

I'd put this in a room somewhere with Bad Rats as company, equally as poor.

reviewText: This game was so unbearable. I could've beat it in less than 2 hours, but the clunky and slippery controls prevented me from enjoying the game. The most I remember from looking at this game are the dark shadows contrasting against the bright background, to it's disadvantage.\n\nI remember nothing from playing this game at all. I just remember being really unsatisfied. Don't buy this game full price, but just don't buy this game at all. I can see that this could've been way better than what it was, but sadly it just sucks.

reviewText:
Fowl space: Fowl delivers a riveting all-new gameplay experience built on an entirely new story, setting and cast of fowls, all powered by a new, next generation fowl space engine that redefines the series for the next generation.

For the first time in fowl space, gamers play as the underdog, fighting as part of a single squad against an enemy that has superior numbers and coffe. fowl space‚Äô genre-defining multiplayer delivers gameplay innovations throughout, including dynamic map events and character customization.

reviewText:
Boring, and I could find something similiar for free on a flash games website.

From the short 11 minutes I spent playing this game, I didn't enjoy it. Obviously.

The mechanics were clunky, everything felt like it was in slow-mo. This weird goo-spitting gun on your back you use to attack enemies with a chance for blind them and have them run around confused and blind. You can also charge up the gun to do a shotgun blast. The amount of pellets depends on how long you hold the attack button.

The goo-gun isn't fun, it doesn't have any kind of impact. You just click, some goo spits out, possibly hits enemy, apparently they take damage and after consecutive goo-shots they die. Great.

The game's level design is boring and there's a shape-shifting background that will probably give players a feeling of motion sickness because it's always shifting and fluctuating 2 different colors that change based on events happening in the game.

I got this game intially because it seemed crude, quirky, and fun. Also because the banner FOWL SPACE" with that cool-looking colored chicken next to it looked pretty rad. Though I felt a little silly after noticing everythings black and white on the foreground
date: then grey in the middle-background. Then the actual background is two random colors. So visually the game isn't appeasing to look at

reviewText: Fowl Space is a platforming game that wants to mix classical games with the platformers of today but is it a game you will want to check out ? In Fowl Space you play as a chicken who goes to a Sun station to destroy it. But is it good ? The game has to be one of the worst platformers on Earth. The game has a terrible platforming segments that barely work and one of the shortest games on the planet clocking in around an 1 hour of entertainment if you can call it that. The game is played like a 2D side scroller with some shooting mechanics attached to it. The game is so easy you can finish it in around an hour. The game is riddled with bugs that make some segments hard to beat. If you liked the game in the first place theres some challenges rooms to play but theyre so boring it will make you want to shoot yourself in the head.  The game has a painfully dull soundtrack that will make youre ears bleed. Graphiclly the game looks like nothing special all of it is black presented on a coulour background the platforms and where you can go mix with the enviroments and it becomes difficult to navigate. Overall this game is amazingly bad and how did they mess it up is beyond me. Bad music, mediocre graphics, and bad gameplay overall this game is a game that you should pick up if you like bad games but to everyone else STAY AWAY i give Fowl Space a 2.5/10

reviewText: Holy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• I was just miding my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing Business and I was my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•-ass friend sent me a gift on steam it's called Fowl Space." voteText: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
http://youtu.be/yDOPOF_5iDg
I played Fowl Space for only 20 minutes or so until the first boss (not because I don‚Äôt like the game, it was awesome).

It is about shooting white stuff into the faces of Vikings (Seriously!).

The game looks really good. Most characters and objects are just a black silhouette but they look really good. The music is good. Controlling the character feels nice and smooth (I played Bad Bots just before this lol). The game is filled with dirty jokes associated with your primary weapons which shoots unidentified white stuff. It is really fun even just to spam it all over the place (God that must sound awful).

Any I really enjoyed it, it‚Äôs very funny. The boss fight was good. It has nuclear bomb riding vikings (Dr. Strangelove style).

On steam the full price is $5 and is probably worth it (I can‚Äôt say for sure because I didn‚Äôt play that much). At the moment it is 90% percent off and only $0.50. Was definitely worth getting at that price.

Click here for more let‚Äôs play videos =)

reviewText: The controls are very slippery and even non-responsive at times. You'll often find yourself stuck in midair -- unable to move until you get hit enough times. The enemies and level design are boring and generic, and, unless you find old internet memes funny, there's not much to laugh at either. I got to the boss for the second stage before calling it quits.

reviewerDisplayName: A E S T H E T I C  B O I
reviewText:
Fowl Space is the Citizen Kane of gaming. Not only does it sport some snazzy humor for the whole family. It also fills the gaming void in your heart that you've been waiting for. If you're looking for a game that'll make you laugh, that'll make you cry, and most importantly, will make your bowels ache until the arrival of Fowl Space II, then you found that game.. I couldn't recommend this game any higher than I would my PEZ collection.


10/10 Would play again- Renegawd

reviewText: This is by far the most intellectually compelling piece of digital content I have ever had the priveledge of owning. This single digital downloa- NAY, digital ART will drive you to laughter, tears, anger, and happiness all at once as you fling exploding white cats at questionably-evil space vikings from within the sun as the one and only Astrocock" with varying degrees of difficulty! The concept is simple and the graphics mimic such games as Limbo (to a degree) with most characters being three-dimensional sillouettes. Despite this
date: the game is simply beautiful. Honestly
recommended: if you have yet to buy this magnificent game
hoursPlayed: I question your mental stability as of right now."
